bioghist.p: Richard John Owen (1887-1961) was born in Wales. In 1907 he emigrated to the United States, working in Colorado, Pennsylvania, and Vermont. He began preaching in 1912 in Vermont, and served as a pastor in churches in Vermont, Pennsylvania, and New York. In 1935 he moved to Minnesota, where he served in churches in Carmel, Salem, and Jerusalem.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of sermons, clippings, and other papers of Richard John Owen. Materials include a volume of sermons preached between 1912 and 1939; sermons and notes for sermons, 1923 to 1953, some in Welsh; funeral addresses; notes on readings; a scrapbook of newspaper clippings, mostly in Welsh; loose clippings in English and Welsh; a commonplace book of poems; a published edition of the Book of Common Worship; Owen's 1920 passport; and several photographs.
